Posts.Content: Hi, yes I had radiotherapy 2years ago and where I was red and peeling then, still gets very sore and peels now. Did ask in the radiotherapy unit about this, and was told it was not the radiotherapy, well , it's in the same exact place, and when flared up, looks like I just had the radiotherapy. Very difficult to wear a bra, even a soft stretchy one, and gets even sorer when I get a bit sweaty under there. Feel very sorry for you, is very uncomfortable, but all I get is denials that it has anything to do with my treatment, which I think is a lie, or they just don't look into it. The nearest I got to them saying anything is "it's better than being dead", well thanks a lot, seem to get that  sort of answer all the time. Yes, I appreciate my treatment, but I would like to get on with a so called normal life, but surely there is no need to feel uncomfortable all the time. I was told, (off the record) it was because the skin is damaged in the area, much thinner, and so anything rubbing, or sweaty acidity causes the skin to break down.
Posts.Title: pain and blisters after radiotherapy
